block.p: Elizabeth K. Bagot, a daughter of Kenneth G. Bagot of St. Petersburg, Fla., and the late Roseann M. Bagot, was married yesterday to Arthur C. Huh, a son of Heung-Sook Huh and Dr. Soung-Yoon Huh of Lima, Ohio. The Rev. Boniface Ramsey performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.

The bride, 29, is keeping her name. She is an account manager at Kirshenbaum, Bond & Partners, an advertising agency in New York. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, who is retired, was an owner of Hopkins-Bagot, publisher's representatives in Nashville, Tenn. The bride's stepmother, Anne F. Sweazey, is a development consultant for nonprofit organizations in St. Petersburg.

Elizabeth K. Bagot, a daughter of Kenneth G. Bagot of St. Petersburg, Fla., and the late Roseann M. Bagot, was married yesterday to Arthur C. Huh, a son of Heung-Sook Huh and Dr. Soung-Yoon Huh of Lima, Ohio. The Rev. Boniface Ramsey performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York.

The bride, 29, is keeping her name. She is an account manager at Kirshenbaum, Bond & Partners, an advertising agency in New York. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father, who is retired, was an owner of Hopkins-Bagot, publisher's representatives in Nashville, Tenn. The bride's stepmother, Anne F. Sweazey, is a development consultant for nonprofit organizations in St. Petersburg.

The bridegroom, 30, is a preservationist for the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission. He graduated from Penn and received a master's degree in urban planning from Columbia. His father, an anesthesiologist, practices in Lima.
